result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy H Hardyman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy H Hardyman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy H Hardyman was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.

Concur to 18CT260 and 17CF2491 but consec to any other sentence.   To be served in WPS pursuant to sec. 973.03(2).
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Concurrent with: 18ct260 and 17CF2491
